contents.text: Abstract
contents.zh-CHS: 摘要

contents.text: This document specifies EAP-PSK, an Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) method for mutual authentication and session key derivation using a Pre-Shared Key (PSK). EAP-PSK provides a protected communication channel when mutual authentication is successful for both parties to communicate over. This document describes the use of this channel only for protected exchange of result indications, but future EAP-PSK extensions may use the channel for other purposes. EAP-PSK is designed for authentication over insecure networks such as IEEE 802.11.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档指定了EAP-PSK，这是一种可扩展身份验证协议（EAP）方法，用于使用预共享密钥（PSK）进行相互身份验证和会话密钥派生。EAP-PSK在双方成功通过相互身份验证进行通信时提供受保护的通信信道。本文档描述了该通道仅用于结果指示的受保护交换，但未来的EAP-PSK扩展可能会将该通道用于其他目的。EAP-PSK设计用于在不安全网络（如IEEE 802.11）上进行身份验证。

contents.zh-CHS: 目录

contents.text: 1. Introduction
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 介绍

contents.text: 1.1. Design Goals for EAP-PSK
contents.zh-CHS: 1.1. EAP-PSK的设计目标

contents.text: The Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) [3] provides an authentication framework that supports multiple authentication methods.
contents.zh-CHS: 可扩展身份验证协议（EAP）[3]提供了支持多种身份验证方法的身份验证框架。

contents.text: This document specifies an EAP method, called EAP-PSK, that uses a Pre-Shared Key (PSK).
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档指定了一种称为EAP-PSK的EAP方法，该方法使用预共享密钥（PSK）。

contents.text: EAP-PSK was developed at France Telecom R&D in 2003-2004. It is published as an RFC for the general information of the Internet community and to allow independent implementations.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK于2003-2004年由法国电信研发部开发。它作为RFC发布，用于互联网社区的一般信息，并允许独立实施。

contents.text: Because PSKs are of frequent use in security protocols, other protocols may also refer to a PSK or contain this word in their name. For instance, Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) [48] specifies an authentication mode called "WPA-PSK". EAP-PSK is distinct from these protocols and should not be confused with them.
contents.zh-CHS: 由于PSK在安全协议中经常使用，其他协议也可能引用PSK或在其名称中包含此词。例如，Wi-Fi保护访问（WPA）[48]指定了一种称为“WPA-PSK”的身份验证模式。EAP-PSK与这些协议不同，不应与它们混淆。

contents.text: Design goals for EAP-PSK were:
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK的设计目标为：

contents.text: o Simplicity: EAP-PSK should be easy to implement and deploy without any pre-existing infrastructure. It should be available quickly because recently-released protocols, such as IEEE 802.11i [27], employ EAP in a different threat model than PPP [44] and thus require "modern" EAP methods.
contents.zh-CHS: o 简单性：EAP-PSK应易于实施和部署，无需任何预先存在的基础架构。它应该可以很快获得，因为最近发布的协议，如IEEE 802.11i[27]，在不同于PPP[44]的威胁模型中使用EAP，因此需要“现代”EAP方法。

contents.text: o Wide applicability: EAP-PSK should be suitable to authenticate over any network, and in particular over IEEE 802.11 [28] wireless LANs.
contents.zh-CHS: o 广泛适用性：EAP-PSK应适用于在任何网络上进行身份验证，特别是在IEEE 802.11[28]无线局域网上。

contents.text: o Security: EAP-PSK should be conservative in its cryptographic design.
contents.zh-CHS: o 安全性：EAP-PSK的密码设计应保守。

contents.text: o Extensibility: EAP-PSK should be easily extensible.
contents.zh-CHS: o 可扩展性：EAP-PSK应该易于扩展。

contents.text: 1.1.1. Simplicity
For the sake of simplicity, EAP-PSK relies on a single cryptographic primitive, AES-128 [7].
contents.zh-CHS: 为了简单起见，EAP-PSK依赖于单个加密原语AES-128[7]。

contents.text: Restriction to such a primitive, and in particular, not using asymmetric cryptography like Diffie-Hellman key exchange, makes EAP-PSK:
contents.zh-CHS: 对此类原语的限制，尤其是不使用Diffie-Hellman密钥交换等非对称加密，使得EAP-PSK：

contents.text: o Easy to understand and implement while avoiding cryptographic negotiations.
contents.zh-CHS: o 易于理解和实现，同时避免加密协商。

contents.text: o Lightweight and well suited for any type of device, especially those with little processing power and memory.
contents.zh-CHS: o 重量轻，非常适合任何类型的设备，尤其是那些处理能力和内存很少的设备。

contents.text: However, as further discussed in Section 8, this prevents EAP-PSK from offering advanced features such as identity protection, password support, or Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS). This choice has been deliberately made as a trade-off between simplicity and security.
contents.zh-CHS: 但是，如第8节中进一步讨论的，这会阻止EAP-PSK提供身份保护、密码支持或完美前向保密（PFS）等高级功能。这种选择是为了在简单性和安全性之间进行权衡。

contents.text: For the sake of simplicity, EAP-PSK has also chosen a fixed message format and not a Type-Length-Value (TLV) design.
contents.zh-CHS: 为了简单起见，EAP-PSK还选择了固定的消息格式，而不是类型长度值（TLV）设计。

contents.text: 1.1.2. Wide Applicability
contents.zh-CHS: 1.1.2. 广泛适用性

contents.text: EAP-PSK has been designed in a threat model where the attacker has full control over the communication channel. This is the EAP threat model that is presented in Section 7.1 of [3].
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK是在威胁模型中设计的，攻击者可以完全控制通信通道。这是[3]第7.1节中介绍的EAP威胁模型。

contents.text: 1.1.3. Security

Since the design of authenticated key exchange is notoriously known to be hard and error prone, EAP-PSK tries to avoid inventing any new cryptographic mechanism. It attempts instead to build on existing primitives and protocols that have been reviewed by the cryptographic community.
contents.zh-CHS: 由于众所周知，经过身份验证的密钥交换的设计很难且容易出错，EAP-PSK试图避免发明任何新的加密机制。相反，它试图建立在加密社区已经审查过的现有原语和协议的基础上。

contents.text: 1.1.4. Extensibility

EAP-PSK explicitly provides a mechanism to allow future extensions within its protected channel (see Section 3.3). Thanks to this mechanism, EAP-PSK will be able to provide more sophisticated services as the need to do so arises.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK明确提供了一种机制，允许在其受保护通道内进行未来扩展（见第3.3节）。由于这种机制，EAP-PSK将能够在需要时提供更复杂的服务。

contents.text: 1.2. Terminology
Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) Please refer to [10] for more details.
contents.zh-CHS: 认证、授权和记帐（AAA）有关更多详细信息，请参阅[10]。

contents.text: AES-128 A block cipher specified in the Advanced Encryption Standard [7].
contents.zh-CHS: AES-128高级加密标准[7]中规定的分组密码。

contents.text: Authentication Key (AK) A 16-byte key derived from the PSK that the EAP peer and server use to mutually authenticate.
contents.zh-CHS: 认证密钥（AK）：从PSK派生的16字节密钥，EAP对等方和服务器使用该密钥进行相互认证。

contents.text: AKEP2 An authenticated key exchange protocol; please refer to [14] for more details.
contents.zh-CHS: AKEP2是一种经过认证的密钥交换协议；有关更多详细信息，请参阅[14]。

contents.text: Backend Authentication Server An entity that provides an authentication service to an Authenticator. When used, this server typically executes EAP methods for the Authenticator. (This terminology is also used in [26], and has the same meaning in this document.)
contents.zh-CHS: 后端身份验证服务器向身份验证程序提供身份验证服务的实体。使用时，此服务器通常为身份验证程序执行EAP方法。（该术语也在[26]中使用，在本文件中具有相同的含义。）

contents.text: CMAC Cipher-based Message Authentication Code. It is the authentication mode of operation of AES recommended by NIST in [8].
contents.zh-CHS: 基于CMAC密码的消息认证码。这是NIST在[8]中推荐的AES操作认证模式。

contents.text: Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) Defined in [3].
contents.zh-CHS: [3]中定义的可扩展身份验证协议（EAP）。

contents.text: EAP Authenticator (or simply Authenticator) The end of the EAP link initiating the EAP authentication methods. (This terminology is also used in [26], and has the same meaning in this document.)
contents.zh-CHS: EAP认证器（或简称认证器）启动EAP认证方法的EAP链路的末端。（该术语也在[26]中使用，在本文件中具有相同的含义。）

contents.text: EAP peer (or simply peer) The end of the EAP link that responds to the Authenticator. (In [26], this end is known as the Supplicant.)
contents.zh-CHS: EAP对等（或简单对等）响应身份验证程序的EAP链路的末端。（在[26]中，这一端被称为恳求者。）

contents.text: EAP server (or simply server) The entity that terminates the EAP authentication with the peer. When there is no Backend Authentication Server, this term refers to the EAP Authenticator. Where the EAP Authenticator operates in pass-through mode, it refers to the Backend Authentication Server.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP服务器（或简称服务器）终止与对等方的EAP身份验证的实体。当没有后端身份验证服务器时，该术语指的是EAP身份验证程序。当EAP认证器以直通模式运行时，它指的是后端认证服务器。

contents.text: EAX An authenticated-encryption with associated data mode of operation for block ciphers [4].
contents.zh-CHS: EAX一种具有分组密码相关数据操作模式的认证加密[4]。

contents.text: Extended Master Session Key (EMSK) Additional keying material derived between the EAP peer and server that is exported by the EAP method. The EMSK is reserved for future uses that are not defined yet and is not provided to a third party. Please refer to [9] for more details. EAP-PSK generates a 64-byte EMSK.
contents.zh-CHS: 扩展主会话密钥（EMSK）：在EAP对等方和服务器之间派生的、通过EAP方法导出的附加密钥材料。EMSK保留用于尚未定义且未提供给第三方的未来用途。有关更多详细信息，请参阅[9]。EAP-PSK生成一个64字节的EMSK。

contents.text: Initialization Vector (IV) A quantity of at least 64 bytes, suitable for use in an initialization vector field, that is derived between the peer and EAP server. Since the IV is a known value in
contents.zh-CHS: 初始化向量（IV）在对等服务器和EAP服务器之间导出的至少64字节的量，适合在初始化向量字段中使用。因为IV是一个已知的

contents.text: methods such as EAP-TLS [11], it cannot be used by itself for computation of any quantity that needs to remain secret. As a result, its use has been deprecated and EAP methods are not required to generate it. Please refer to [9] for more details. EAP-PSK does not generate an IV.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-TLS等方法[11]本身不能用于计算需要保密的任何数量。因此，它的使用已被弃用，并且不需要EAP方法来生成它。有关更多详细信息，请参阅[9]。EAP-PSK不生成IV。

contents.text: Key-Derivation Key (KDK) A 16-byte key derived from the PSK that the EAP peer and server use to derive session keys (namely, the TEK, MSK, and EMSK).
contents.zh-CHS: 密钥派生密钥（KDK）：从PSK派生的16字节密钥，EAP对等方和服务器使用该密钥派生会话密钥（即TEK、MSK和EMSK）。

contents.text: Message Authentication Code (MAC) Informally, the purpose of a MAC is to provide assurances regarding both the source of a message and its integrity [40]. IEEE 802.11i uses the acronym MIC (Message Integrity Check) to avoid confusion with the other meaning of the acronym MAC (Medium Access Control).
contents.zh-CHS: 消息认证码（MAC）非正式地说，MAC的目的是提供关于消息源及其完整性的保证[40]。IEEE 802.11i使用缩写词MIC（消息完整性检查），以避免与缩写词MAC（媒体访问控制）的其他含义混淆。

contents.text: Master Session Key (MSK) Keying material that is derived between the EAP peer and server and exported by the EAP method. In existing implementations, a AAA server acting as an EAP server transports the MSK to the Authenticator [9]. EAP-PSK generates a 64-byte MSK.
contents.zh-CHS: 主会话密钥（MSK）是在EAP对等方和服务器之间派生并通过EAP方法导出的密钥材料。在现有实现中，充当EAP服务器的AAA服务器将MSK传输到验证器[9]。EAP-PSK生成一个64字节的MSK。

contents.text: Network Access Identifier (NAI) Identifier used to identify the communicating parties [2].
contents.zh-CHS: 网络访问标识符（NAI）用于标识通信方的标识符[2]。

contents.text: One Key CBC-MAC 1 (OMAC1) A method to generate a Message Authentication Code [29]. CMAC is the name under which NIST has standardized OMAC1.
contents.zh-CHS: 一键CBC-MAC 1（OMAC1）生成消息认证码的方法[29]。CMAC是NIST标准化OMAC1的名称。

contents.text: Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS) The confidence that the compromise of a long-term private key does not compromise any earlier session keys. In other words, once an EAP dialog is finished and its corresponding keys are forgotten, even someone who has recorded all of the data from the connection and gets access to all of the long-term keys of the peer and the server cannot reconstruct the keys used to protect the conversation without doing a brute-force search of the session key space.
contents.zh-CHS: 完美前向保密（PFS）长期私钥泄露不会泄露任何早期会话密钥的信心。换句话说，一旦EAP对话完成并且忘记了相应的密钥，即使是记录了连接中的所有数据并访问了对等方和服务器的所有长期密钥的人，如果不对会话密钥空间进行强制搜索，也无法重构用于保护对话的密钥。

contents.text: EAP-PSK does not have this property.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK不具有此属性。

contents.text: Pre-Shared Key (PSK) A Pre-Shared Key simply means a key in symmetric cryptography. This key is derived by some prior mechanism and shared between the parties before the protocol using it takes place. It is merely a bit sequence of given length, each bit of which has been chosen at random uniformly and independently. For EAP-PSK, the PSK is the long-term 16- byte credential shared by the EAP peer and server.
contents.zh-CHS: 预共享密钥（PSK）预共享密钥仅指对称密码中的密钥。这个密钥是由一些先前的机制派生出来的，并在使用它的协议发生之前在双方之间共享。它仅仅是一个给定长度的位序列，其中的每一位都是均匀地、独立地随机选择的。对于EAP-PSK，PSK是EAP对等方和服务器共享的长期16字节凭证。

contents.text: Protected Result Indication Please refer to Section 7.16 of [3] for a definition of this term. This feature has been introduced because EAP-Success/Failure packets are unidirectional and are not protected.
contents.zh-CHS: 受保护结果指示有关该术语的定义，请参考[3]第7.16节。引入此功能是因为EAP成功/失败数据包是单向的且不受保护。

contents.text: Transient EAP Key (TEK) A session key that is used to establish a protected channel between the EAP peer and server during the EAP authentication exchange. The TEK is appropriate for use with the ciphersuite negotiated between the EAP peer and server to protect the EAP conversation. Note that the ciphersuite used to set up the protected channel between the EAP peer and server during EAP authentication is unrelated to the ciphersuite used to subsequently protect data sent between the EAP peer and Authenticator [9]. EAP-PSK uses a 16-byte TEK for its protected channel, which is the only ciphersuite available between the EAP peer and server to protect the EAP conversation. This ciphersuite uses AES-128 in the EAX mode of operation.
contents.zh-CHS: 瞬态EAP密钥（TEK）：在EAP身份验证交换期间，用于在EAP对等方和服务器之间建立受保护通道的会话密钥。TEK适合与EAP对等方和服务器之间协商的密码套件一起使用，以保护EAP对话。请注意，在EAP身份验证期间用于在EAP对等方和服务器之间设置受保护通道的密码套件与随后用于保护EAP对等方和身份验证方之间发送的数据的密码套件无关[9]。EAP-PSK使用16字节TEK作为其受保护通道，这是EAP对等方和服务器之间唯一可用于保护EAP会话的密码套件。此密码套件在EAX操作模式下使用AES-128。

contents.text: 1.3. Conventions
All numbers presented in this document are considered in network-byte order.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中的所有数字均按网络字节顺序考虑。

contents.text: || denotes concatenation of strings (and not the logical OR).
contents.zh-CHS: ||表示字符串的串联（而不是逻辑OR）。

contents.text: MAC(K, String) denotes the MAC of String under the key K (the algorithm used in this document to compute the MACs is CMAC with AES-128; see Section 3.2).
contents.zh-CHS: MAC（K，String）表示密钥K下字符串的MAC（本文档中用于计算MAC的算法是带有AES-128的CMAC；参见第3.2节）。

contents.text: [String] denotes the concatenation of String with the MAC of String calculated as specified by the context. Hence, we have, with K specified by the context: [String]=String||MAC(K,String)
contents.zh-CHS: [String]表示字符串与上下文指定的字符串MAC的连接。因此，我们有，由上下文指定的K:[String]=String | | MAC（K，String）

contents.text: ** denotes integer exponentiation.
contents.zh-CHS: **表示整数幂运算。

contents.text: "i" denotes the unsigned binary representation on 16 bytes of the integer i in network byte order. Therefore, this notation only makes sense when i is between 0 and 2**128-1.
contents.zh-CHS: “i”表示整数i的16个字节（按网络字节顺序）上的无符号二进制表示。因此，只有当i介于0和2**128-1之间时，此符号才有意义。

contents.text: <i> denotes the unsigned binary representation on 4 bytes of the integer i in network byte order. Therefore, this notation only makes sense when i is between 0 and 2**32-1.
contents.zh-CHS: <i> 以网络字节顺序表示整数i的4个字节上的无符号二进制表示。因此，只有当i介于0和2**32-1之间时，此符号才有意义。

contents.text: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in [1].
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中的关键词“必须”、“不得”、“必需”、“应”、“不应”、“应”、“不应”、“建议”、“可”和“可选”应按照[1]中所述进行解释。

contents.text: 1.4. Related Work
contents.zh-CHS: 1.4. 相关工作

contents.text: At the time this document is written, only three EAP methods are standards track EAP methods per IETF terminology (see [17]), namely:
contents.zh-CHS: 在编写本文件时，根据IETF术语（见[17]），只有三种EAP方法是标准跟踪EAP方法，即：

contents.text: o MD5-Challenge (EAP-Request/Response type 4), defined in [3], which uses a MD5 challenge similar to [45].
contents.zh-CHS: o [3]中定义的MD5质询（EAP请求/响应类型4），它使用类似于[45]的MD5质询。

contents.text: o OTP (EAP-Request/Response type 5), defined in [3], which aims at providing One-Time Password support similar to [22] and [39].
contents.zh-CHS: o OTP（EAP请求/响应类型5），定义于[3]，旨在提供类似于[22]和[39]的一次性密码支持。

contents.text: o GTC (EAP-Request/Response type 6), defined in [3], which aims at providing Generic Token Card Support.
contents.zh-CHS: o [3]中定义的GTC（EAP请求/响应类型6），旨在提供通用令牌卡支持。

contents.text: Unfortunately, all three methods are deprecated for security reasons that are explained in part in [3].
contents.zh-CHS: 不幸的是，由于[3]中部分解释的安全原因，这三种方法都被弃用。

contents.text: Myriads of EAP methods have, however, been otherwise proposed:
contents.zh-CHS: 然而，另有无数EAP方法被提出：

contents.text: o One as an experimental RFC (EAP-TLS [11]), which therefore is not a standard (see [25]).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个作为实验RFC（EAP-TLS[11]），因此不是标准（见[25]）。

contents.text: o Some as individual Internet-Draft submissions (e.g., [42] or this document).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一些作为个人互联网草案提交（例如，[42]或本文件）。

contents.text: o And some even undocumented (e.g., Rob EAP, which has EAP-Request/ Response type 31).
contents.zh-CHS: o 还有一些甚至没有记录（例如Rob EAP，其EAP请求/响应类型为31）。

contents.text: However, no secure and mature Pre-Shared Key EAP method is yet easily and widely available, which is all the more regrettable because Pre-Shared Key methods are the most basic ones!
contents.zh-CHS: 然而，目前还没有一种安全、成熟的预共享密钥EAP方法可以轻松、广泛地使用，这更令人遗憾，因为预共享密钥方法是最基本的方法！

contents.text: The existing proposals for a future Pre-Shared Key EAP method are briefly reviewed hereafter (please refer to [16] for a more thorough synthesis of EAP methods).
contents.zh-CHS: 下文简要回顾了未来预共享密钥EAP方法的现有建议（请参考[16]了解EAP方法的更全面综合）。

contents.text: Among these proposals, there are some that:
contents.zh-CHS: 在这些建议中，有一些是：

contents.text: o Are broken from a security point of view, e.g.:
contents.zh-CHS: o 从安全角度来看是不可靠的，例如：

contents.text: * LEAP, which is specified in [38] and whose vulnerabilities are discussed in [49].
contents.zh-CHS: * [38]中规定的LEAP，其漏洞在[49]中讨论。

contents.text: * EAP-MSCHAPv2, which is specified in [34] and whose vulnerabilities are indirectly discussed in [43].
contents.zh-CHS: * EAP-MSCHAPv2，在[34]中指定，其漏洞在[43]中间接讨论。

contents.text: o Essentially require additional infrastructure, e.g., EAP-SIM [24], EAP-AKA [12], or OTP/token card methods like [31].
contents.zh-CHS: o 基本上需要额外的基础设施，例如EAP-SIM[24]、EAP-AKA[12]或OTP/令牌卡方法，如[31]。

contents.text: o Are not shared key methods but are often confused with them, namely, the password methods, e.g., EAP-SRP [18] or SPEKE [30], whose wide adoption very unfortunately seems to be hindered by Intellectual Property Rights issues.
contents.zh-CHS: o 不是共享密钥方法，但经常与之混淆，即密码方法，例如EAP-SRP[18]或SPEKE[30]，其广泛采用似乎很不幸地受到知识产权问题的阻碍。

contents.text: o Are generic tunneling methods, which do not essentially rely on Pre-Shared Keys as they require a public-key certificate for the server and allow the peer to authenticate with whatever EAP method or even other non-EAP authentication mechanisms, namely, [32] and [21].
contents.zh-CHS: o 是通用隧道方法，基本上不依赖预共享密钥，因为它们需要服务器的公钥证书，并允许对等方使用任何EAP方法或甚至其他非EAP身份验证机制进行身份验证，即[32]和[21]。

contents.text: o Are abandoned but have provided the basis for EAP-PSK, namely, EAP-Archie [47].
contents.zh-CHS: o 已放弃，但为EAP-PSK提供了基础，即EAP ARCHE[47]。

contents.text: o Are possible alternatives to EAP-PSK (i.e., claimed to be secure and subject of active work):
contents.zh-CHS: o 是否有EAP-PSK的可能替代品（即，声称安全且主动工作的主体）：

contents.text: * EAP-FAST [42].
contents.zh-CHS: * EAP-FAST[42]。

contents.text: * EAP-IKEv2 [46].
contents.zh-CHS: * EAP-IKEv2[46]。

contents.text: * EAP-TLS (when shared key/password support is added to TLS; see [50]).
contents.zh-CHS: * EAP-TLS（当共享密钥/密码支持添加到TLS时；请参见[50]）。

contents.text: EAP-PSK differs from the aforementioned methods on the following points:
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK在以下几点上与上述方法不同：

contents.text: o No attacks on EAP-PSK within its threat model have yet been found.
contents.zh-CHS: o 尚未发现EAP-PSK在其威胁模型中受到攻击。

contents.text: o EAP-PSK was not designed to leverage a pre-existing infrastructure. Thus, it does not inherit potential limitations of such an infrastructure and it should be easier to deploy "from scratch".
contents.zh-CHS: o EAP-PSK的设计目的不是利用现有的基础设施。因此，它不会继承这样一个基础设施的潜在限制，而且应该更容易“从头开始”部署。

contents.text: o EAP-PSK wished to avoid IPR blockages.
contents.zh-CHS: o EAP-PSK希望避免知识产权封锁。

contents.text: o EAP-PSK does not have any dependencies on protocols other than EAP.
contents.zh-CHS: o EAP-PSK对EAP以外的协议没有任何依赖关系。

contents.text: o EAP-PSK was restricted to simply proposing a Pre-Shared Key method with symmetric cryptography
contents.zh-CHS: o EAP-PSK仅限于提出一种具有对称密码的预共享密钥方法

contents.text: * To remain simple to understand and implement
contents.zh-CHS: * 保持简单易懂和易于实施

contents.text: * To avoid potentially complex configurations and negotiations
contents.zh-CHS: * 避免潜在的复杂配置和协商

contents.text: o EAP-PSK was designed with efficiency in mind.
contents.zh-CHS: o EAP-PSK的设计考虑了效率。

contents.text: 2. Protocol Overview
contents.zh-CHS: 2. 协议概述

contents.text: Figure 1 presents an overview of the EAP-PSK key hierarchy.
contents.zh-CHS: 图1概述了EAP-PSK密钥层次结构。

contents.text: Figure 1: EAP-PSK Key Hierarchy Overview
contents.zh-CHS: 图1:EAP-PSK密钥层次结构概述

contents.text: 2.1. EAP-PSK Key Hierarchy
contents.zh-CHS: 2.1. EAP-PSK密钥层次结构

contents.text: This section presents the key hierarchy used by EAP-PSK. This hierarchy is inspired by the EAP key hierarchy described in [9].
contents.zh-CHS: 本节介绍EAP-PSK使用的密钥层次结构。该层次结构受[9]中描述的EAP密钥层次结构的启发。

contents.text: 2.1.1. The PSK
The PSK is shared between the EAP peer and the EAP server.
contents.zh-CHS: PSK在EAP对等方和EAP服务器之间共享。

contents.text: EAP-PSK assumes that the PSK is known only to the EAP peer and EAP server. The security properties of the protocol are compromised if it has wider distribution. Please note that EAP-PSK shares this property with all other symmetric key methods (including all password-based methods).
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK假定PSK仅为EAP对等方和EAP服务器所知。如果协议具有更广泛的分布，则其安全属性会受到损害。请注意，EAP-PSK与所有其他对称密钥方法（包括所有基于密码的方法）共享此属性。

contents.text: EAP-PSK also assumes the EAP server and EAP peer identify the correct PSK to use with each other thanks to their respective NAIs. This means that there MUST only be at most one PSK shared between an EAP server using a given server NAI and an EAP peer using a given peer NAI.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK还假设EAP服务器和EAP对等方通过各自的NAI识别正确的PSK以相互使用。这意味着，在使用给定服务器NAI的EAP服务器和使用给定对等NAI的EAP对等方之间，最多只能共享一个PSK。

contents.text: This PSK is used, as shown in Figure 2, to derive two 16-byte static long-lived subkeys, respectively called the Authentication Key (AK) and the Key-Derivation Key (KDK). This derivation should only be done once: it is called the key setup. See Section 3.1 for an explanation of why PSK is not used as a static long-lived key, but only as the initial keying material for deriving the static long-lived keys, AK and KDK, which are actually used by the protocol EAP-PSK.
contents.zh-CHS: 如图2所示，此PSK用于派生两个16字节的静态长寿命子密钥，分别称为身份验证密钥（AK）和密钥派生密钥（KDK）。此派生只能执行一次：称为密钥设置。请参见第3.1节，了解为什么PSK不用作静态长寿命密钥，而仅用作派生静态长寿命密钥AK和KDK的初始密钥材料，协议EAP-PSK实际使用这些密钥。

contents.text: Figure 2: Derivation of AK and KDK from the PSK
contents.zh-CHS: 图2：从PSK推导AK和KDK

contents.text: EAP-PSK uses AK to mutually authenticate the EAP peer and the EAP server.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK使用AK相互验证EAP对等方和EAP服务器。

contents.text: AK is a static long-lived key derived from the PSK; see Section 3.1. AK is not a session key.
contents.zh-CHS: AK是从PSK派生的静态长寿命密钥；见第3.1节。AK不是会话密钥。

contents.text: The EAP server and EAP peer identify the correct AK to use with each other thanks to their respective NAIs. This means that there MUST only be at most one AK shared between an EAP server using a given server NAI and an EAP peer using a given peer NAI. This is the case when there is at most one PSK shared between an EAP server using a given server NAI and an EAP peer using a given peer NAI; see Section 2.1.1.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP服务器和EAP对等机通过各自的NAI确定要相互使用的正确AK。这意味着使用给定服务器NAI的EAP服务器和使用给定对等NAI的EAP对等方之间最多只能共享一个AK。这是在使用给定服务器NAI的EAP服务器和使用给定对等NAI的EAP对等之间共享最多一个PSK的情况；见第2.1节。

contents.text: The EAP peer chooses the AK to use based on the EAP server NAI that has been sent by the EAP server in the first EAP-PSK message (namely, ID_S; see Section 4.1) and the EAP peer NAI it chooses to include in the second EAP-PSK message (namely, ID_P; see Section 4.1).
contents.zh-CHS: EAP对等方根据EAP服务器在第一条EAP-PSK消息中发送的EAP服务器NAI（即，ID_S；参见第4.1节）和它选择包含在第二条EAP-PSK消息中的EAP对等方NAI（即，ID_P；参见第4.1节）来选择要使用的AK。

contents.text: EAP-PSK uses KDK to derive session keys shared by the EAP peer and the EAP server (namely, the TEK, MSK, and EMSK).
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK使用KDK派生EAP对等方和EAP服务器（即TEK、MSK和EMSK）共享的会话密钥。

contents.text: KDK is a static long-lived key derived from the PSK; see Section 3.1. KDK is not a session key.
contents.zh-CHS: KDK是从PSK派生的静态长寿命密钥；见第3.1节。KDK不是会话密钥。

contents.text: The EAP server and EAP peer identify the correct AK to use with each other thanks to their respective NAIs. This means that there MUST only be at most one AK shared between an EAP server using a given server NAI and an EAP peer using a given peer NAI. This is the case
contents.zh-CHS: EAP服务器和EAP对等机通过各自的NAI确定要相互使用的正确AK。这意味着使用给定服务器NAI的EAP服务器和使用给定对等NAI的EAP对等方之间最多只能共享一个AK。情况就是这样

contents.text: when there is at most one PSK shared between an EAP server using a given server NAI and an EAP peer using a given peer NAI; see Section 2.1.1.
contents.zh-CHS: 当使用给定服务器NAI的EAP服务器和使用给定对等NAI的EAP对等方之间最多共享一个PSK时；见第2.1节。

contents.text: The EAP peer chooses the AK to use based on the EAP server NAI that has been sent by the EAP server in the first EAP-PSK message (namely, ID_S; see Section 4.1) and the EAP peer NAI it chooses to include in the second EAP-PSK message (namely, ID_P; see Section 4.1).
contents.zh-CHS: EAP对等方根据EAP服务器在第一条EAP-PSK消息中发送的EAP服务器NAI（即，ID_S；参见第4.1节）和它选择包含在第二条EAP-PSK消息中的EAP对等方NAI（即，ID_P；参见第4.1节）来选择要使用的AK。

contents.text: 2.2. The TEK
EAP-PSK derives a 16-byte TEK thanks to a random number exchanged during authentication (RAND_P; see Section 5.1) and KDK.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK通过在身份验证（RAND_P；见第5.1节）和KDK期间交换的随机数派生出一个16字节的TEK。

contents.text: This TEK is used to implement a protected channel for both mutually authenticated parties to communicate over securely.
contents.zh-CHS: 该TEK用于为相互认证的双方实现一个受保护的通道，以便安全地进行通信。

contents.text: 2.3. The MSK
contents.zh-CHS: 2.3. MSK

contents.text: EAP-PSK derives a MSK thanks to a random number exchanged during authentication (RAND_P; see Section 5.1) and the KDK.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK通过身份验证过程中交换的随机数（RAND_P；见第5.1节）和KDK派生MSK。

contents.text: The MSK is 64 bytes long, which complies with [3].
contents.zh-CHS: MSK的长度为64字节，符合[3]。

contents.text: 2.4. The EMSK
contents.zh-CHS: 2.4. EMSK

contents.text: EAP-PSK derives an EMSK thanks to a random number exchanged during authentication (RAND_P; see Section 5.1) and the KDK.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK通过身份验证过程中交换的随机数（RAND_P；见第5.1节）和KDK来获得EMSK。

contents.text: The EMSK is 64 bytes long, which complies with [3].
contents.zh-CHS: EMSK的长度为64字节，符合[3]。

contents.text: 2.5. The IV
EAP-PSK does not derive any IV, which complies with [9].
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK不衍生任何符合[9]的IV。

contents.text: 3. Cryptographic Design of EAP-PSK
contents.zh-CHS: 3. EAP-PSK的密码设计

contents.text: EAP-PSK relies on a single cryptographic primitive, a block cipher, which is instantiated with AES-128. AES-128 takes a 16-byte Pre-Shared Key and a 16-byte Plain Text block as inputs. It outputs a 16-byte Cipher Text block. For a detailed description of AES-128, please refer to [7].
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK依赖于一个加密原语，即分组密码，该原语由AES-128实例化。AES-128采用16字节预共享密钥和16字节纯文本块作为输入。它输出一个16字节的密码文本块。有关AES-128的详细说明，请参阅[7]。

contents.text: AES-128 has been chosen because:
contents.zh-CHS: 选择AES-128是因为：

contents.text: o It is standardized and implementations are widely available.
contents.zh-CHS: o 它是标准化的，并且可以广泛使用。

contents.text: o It has been carefully reviewed by the cryptographic community and is believed to be secure.
contents.zh-CHS: o 加密社区已经仔细审查了它，并认为它是安全的。

contents.text: Other block ciphers could easily be proposed for EAP-PSK, as EAP-PSK does not intrinsically depend on AES-128. The only parameters of AES-128 that EAP-PSK depends on are the AES-128 block and key size (16 bytes). For the sake of simplicity, EAP-PSK has, however, been chosen to restrict to a single mandatory block cipher and not allow the negotiation of other block ciphers. In the case that AES-128 is deprecated for security reasons, EAP-PSK should also be deprecated and a cut-and-paste EAP-PSK' should be defined with another block cipher. This EAP-PSK' should not be backward compatible with EAP-PSK because of the security issues with AES-128. EAP-PSK' should therefore use a different EAP-Request/Response Type number. With the EAP-Request/Response Type number space structure defined in [3], this should not be a problem. The use of a different EAP-Request/Response Type number for EAP-PSK' will prevent this new method from being vulnerable to chosen protocol attacks.
contents.zh-CHS: 由于EAP-PSK本质上并不依赖于AES-128，因此可以很容易地为EAP-PSK提出其他分组密码。EAP-PSK依赖的AES-128的唯一参数是AES-128块和密钥大小（16字节）。然而，为了简单起见，EAP-PSK被选择为仅限于一个强制分组密码，而不允许协商其他分组密码。如果出于安全原因不推荐使用AES-128，则也应不推荐使用EAP-PSK，并应使用另一个分组密码定义剪切粘贴EAP-PSK。由于AES-128存在安全问题，此EAP-PSK不应与EAP-PSK向后兼容。因此，“EAP-PSK”应使用不同的EAP请求/响应类型编号。对于[3]中定义的EAP请求/响应类型数字空间结构，这应该不是问题。为EAP-PSK使用不同的EAP请求/响应类型编号将防止此新方法易受所选协议攻击的攻击。

contents.text: EAP-PSK uses three cryptographic parts:
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK使用三个加密部分：

contents.text: o A key setup to derive AK and KDK from the PSK.
contents.zh-CHS: o 从PSK派生AK和KDK的密钥设置。

contents.text: o An authenticated key exchange protocol to mutually authenticate the communicating parties and derive session keys.
contents.zh-CHS: o 一种经过身份验证的密钥交换协议，用于相互验证通信双方并派生会话密钥。

contents.text: o A protected channel protocol for both mutually authenticated parties to communicate over.
contents.zh-CHS: o 一种受保护的信道协议，供相互认证的双方通过网络进行通信。

contents.text: Each part is discussed in more detail in the subsequent paragraphs.
contents.zh-CHS: 每个部分将在后面的段落中进行更详细的讨论。

contents.text: 3.1. The Key Setup
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1. 密钥设置

contents.text: EAP-PSK needs two cryptographically separated 16-byte subkeys for mutual authentication and session key derivation. Indeed, it is a rule of thumb in cryptography to use different keys for different applications.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK需要两个加密分隔的16字节子密钥，用于相互身份验证和会话密钥派生。事实上，密码学的经验法则是为不同的应用程序使用不同的密钥。

contents.text: It could have implemented these two subkeys either by specifying a 32-byte PSK that would then be split in two 16-byte subkeys, or by specifying a 16-byte PSK that would then be cryptographically expanded to two 16-byte subkeys.
contents.zh-CHS: 它可以通过指定一个32字节的PSK来实现这两个子键，然后将其拆分为两个16字节的子键，或者通过指定一个16字节的PSK，然后将其加密扩展为两个16字节的子键。

contents.text: Because provisioning a 32-byte long-term credential is more cumbersome than a 16-byte one, and the strength of the derived session keys is 16 bytes either way, the latter option was chosen.
contents.zh-CHS: 由于提供32字节的长期凭证比16字节的凭证更麻烦，并且派生会话密钥的强度为16字节，因此选择了后一种选项。

contents.text: Hence, the PSK is only used by EAP-PSK to derive AK and KDK. This derivation should be done only once, immediately after the PSK has been provisioned. As soon as AK and KDK have been derived, the PSK should be deleted. If the PSK is deleted, it should be done so securely (see, for instance, [19] for guidance on secure deletion of the PSK).
contents.zh-CHS: 因此，PSK仅由EAP-PSK用于派生AK和KDK。此推导只应在PSK设置后立即执行一次。一旦获得AK和KDK，就应该删除PSK。如果删除了PSK，则应安全地执行（例如，请参阅[19]了解安全删除PSK的指南）。

contents.text: Derivation of AK and KDK from the PSK is called the key setup:
contents.zh-CHS: 从PSK派生AK和KDK称为密钥设置：

contents.text: o The input to the key setup is the PSK.
contents.zh-CHS: o 钥匙设置的输入是PSK。

contents.text: o The outputs of the key setup are AK and KDK.
contents.zh-CHS: o 钥匙设置的输出为AK和KDK。

contents.text: AK and KDK are derived from the PSK using the modified counter mode of operation of AES-128. The modified counter mode is a length increasing function, i.e., it expands one AES-128 input block into a longer t-block output, where t>=2. This mode was chosen for the key setup because it had already been chosen for the derivation of the session keys (see Section 3.2).
contents.zh-CHS: AK和KDK是使用AES-128改进的计数器操作模式从PSK派生的。修改后的计数器模式是一种长度增加功能，即，它将一个AES-128输入块扩展为更长的t块输出，其中t>=2。选择该模式进行密钥设置是因为已经选择该模式来导出会话密钥（参见第3.2节）。

contents.text: The details of the derivation of AK and KDK from the PSK are shown in Figure 3.
contents.zh-CHS: 图3显示了从PSK派生AK和KDK的详细信息。

contents.text: Figure 3: Derivation of AK and KDK from the PSK in Details
contents.zh-CHS: 图3：从PSK中详细推导AK和KDK

contents.text: The input block is "0". For the sake of simplicity, this input block has been chosen constant: it could have been set to a value depending on the peer and the server (for instance, the XOR of their respective NAIs appropriately truncated or zero-padded), but this did not seem to add much security to the scheme, whereas it added complexity. Any 16-byte constant could have been chosen, as the security is not supposed to depend on the particular value taken by the constant. "0" was arbitrarily chosen.
contents.zh-CHS: 输入块为“0”。为了简单起见，这个输入块被选择为常量：它可以被设置为一个取决于对等方和服务器的值（例如，它们各自的NAI的XOR被适当地截断或零填充），但这似乎并没有给方案增加太多的安全性，反而增加了复杂性。可以选择任何16字节的常量，因为安全性不应取决于该常量采用的特定值。“0”是任意选择的。

contents.text: 3.2. The Authenticated Key Exchange
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2. 认证密钥交换

contents.text: The authentication protocol used by EAP-PSK is inspired by AKEP2, which is described in [14].
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK使用的身份验证协议受[14]中描述的AKEP2启发。

contents.text: AKEP2 consists of a one-and-a-half round-trip exchange, as shown in Figure 4, which is inspired by Figure 5 of [14].
contents.zh-CHS: AKEP2由一个半往返交换组成，如图4所示，其灵感来源于[14]中的图5。

contents.text: Figure 4: Overview of AKEP2
contents.zh-CHS: 图4:AKEP2概述

contents.text: It is also worth noting that [14] focuses on cryptography and not on designing a real-life protocol. Thus, as noted in subsection "Out-Of-Band-Data" of [14], Alice has to send A, its identity, to Bob so that Bob may select the appropriate credential for the sequel to the conversation. This leads to a slightly complemented version of AKEP2 for EAP-PSK as depicted in Figure 5.
contents.zh-CHS: 还值得注意的是[14]关注的是密码学，而不是设计现实生活中的协议。因此，如[14]小节“带外数据”中所述，Alice必须向Bob发送一个其标识，以便Bob可以为对话的续集选择适当的凭证。这导致了图5中所示的EAP-PSK的AKEP2的稍微补充版本。

contents.text: Figure 5: Overview of AKEP2
contents.zh-CHS: 图5:AKEP2概述

contents.text: In AKEP2,
contents.zh-CHS: 在AKEP2中，

contents.text: o RA and RB are random numbers chosen respectively by Alice and Bob.
contents.zh-CHS: o RA和RB是Alice和Bob分别选择的随机数。

contents.text: o A and B are Alice's and Bob's respective identities. They allow Alice and Bob to retrieve the key that they have to use to run an authenticated key exchange between each other. They are also included in the protocol for cryptographic reasons.
contents.zh-CHS: o A和B是爱丽丝和鲍勃各自的身份。它们允许Alice和Bob检索他们必须使用的密钥，以在彼此之间运行经过身份验证的密钥交换。出于加密原因，它们也包含在协议中。

contents.text: o The MACs (see Section 1.3 for the notation "[]") are calculated using a dedicated key.
contents.zh-CHS: o MAC（符号“[]”见第1.3节）使用专用键计算。

contents.text: EAP-PSK instantiates this protocol with:
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK通过以下方式实例化此协议：

contents.text: o The server as Alice and the peer as Bob.
contents.zh-CHS: o 服务器为Alice，对等方为Bob。

contents.text: o RA and RB as 16-byte random numbers, using Section 4.1 notations; this means RA=RAND_S and RB=RAND_P.
contents.zh-CHS: o RA和RB为16字节随机数，使用第4.1节的符号；这意味着RA=RAND_S和RB=RAND_P。

contents.text: o A and B as Alice's and Bob's respective NAIs, using Section 4.1 notations; this means A=ID_S and B=ID_P.
contents.zh-CHS: o A和B作为Alice和Bob各自的NAI，使用第4.1节的符号；这意味着A=ID_S和B=ID_P。

contents.text: o The MAC algorithm as CMAC with AES-128 using AK and producing a tag length of 16 bytes.
contents.zh-CHS: o MAC算法为CMAC，AES-128使用AK并产生16字节的标记长度。

contents.text: o The modified counter mode of operation of AES-128 using KDK, to derive session keys as a result of this exchange.
contents.zh-CHS: o 使用KDK修改AES-128的计数器操作模式，以作为此交换的结果导出会话密钥。

contents.text: CMAC was chosen as the MAC algorithm because it is capable of handling arbitrary length messages, and its design is simple. It also enjoys up-to-date review by the cryptographic community, especially using provable security concepts. It has been recommended by the NIST. For a detailed description of CMAC, please refer to [8].
contents.zh-CHS: 选择CMAC作为MAC算法是因为它能够处理任意长度的消息，并且设计简单。它还受到加密社区的最新审查，特别是使用可证明的安全概念。这是NIST推荐的。有关CMAC的详细说明，请参阅[8]。

contents.text: In AKEP2, the key exchange is "implicit": the session keys are derived from RB. In EAP-PSK, the session keys are thus derived from RAND_P by using KDK and the modified counter mode of operation of AES-128 described in [5]. This mode was chosen because it is a simple key derivation scheme that relies on a block cipher and has a proof of its security. It is a length increasing function, i.e., it expands one AES-128 input block into a longer t-block output, where t>=2. The derivation of the session keys is shown in Figure 6.
contents.zh-CHS: 在AKEP2中，密钥交换是“隐式”的：会话密钥来自RB。在EAP-PSK中，会话密钥因此通过使用KDK和[5]中描述的AES-128的修改计数器操作模式从RAND_P中导出。之所以选择这种模式，是因为它是一种简单的密钥派生方案，依赖于分组密码，并且具有安全性证明。它是一个长度增加函数，即，它将一个AES-128输入块扩展为更长的t块输出，其中t>=2。会话密钥的派生如图6所示。

contents.text: Figure 6: Derivation of the Session Keys
contents.zh-CHS: 图6：会话密钥的推导

contents.text: The input to the derivation of the session keys is RAND_P.
contents.zh-CHS: 会话密钥派生的输入是RAND\u P。

contents.text: The outputs of the derivation of the session keys are:
contents.zh-CHS: 会话密钥派生的输出为：

contents.text: o The 16-byte TEK (the first output block).
contents.zh-CHS: o 16字节TEK（第一个输出块）。

contents.text: o The 64-byte MSK (the concatenation of the second to fifth output blocks).
contents.zh-CHS: o 64字节MSK（第二到第五输出块的串联）。

contents.text: o The 64-byte EMSK (the concatenation of the sixth to ninth output blocks).
contents.zh-CHS: o 64字节EMSK（第六到第九个输出块的串联）。

contents.text: The details of the derivation of the session keys are shown in Figure 7.
contents.zh-CHS: 会话密钥派生的详细信息如图7所示。

contents.text: Figure 7: Derivation of the Session Keys in Details
contents.zh-CHS: 图7：会话密钥的详细推导

contents.text: The counter values are set respectively to the first t integers (that is, ci="i", with i=1 to 9).
contents.zh-CHS: 计数器值分别设置为第一个t整数（即i=1到9的ci=“i”）。

contents.text: Keying material is sensitive information and should be handled accordingly (see Section 8.10 for further discussion).
contents.zh-CHS: 键控材料是敏感信息，应进行相应处理（有关进一步讨论，请参阅第8.10节）。

contents.text: 3.3. The Protected Channel
contents.zh-CHS: 3.3. 受保护通道

contents.text: EAP-PSK provides a protected channel for both parties to communicate over, in case of a successful authentication. This protected channel is currently used to exchange protected result indications and may be used in the future to implement extensions.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK为双方提供了一个受保护的通道，以便在认证成功的情况下进行通信。此受保护通道当前用于交换受保护的结果指示，将来可能用于实现扩展。

contents.text: EAP-PSK uses the EAX mode of operation to provide this protected channel. For a detailed description of EAX, please refer to [4]. Figure 8 shows how EAX is used to implement EAP-PSK protected channel.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK使用EAX操作模式来提供此受保护信道。有关EAX的详细说明，请参阅[4]。图8显示了如何使用EAX实现EAP-PSK保护通道。

contents.text: Figure 8: The Protected Channel
contents.zh-CHS: 图8：受保护的通道

contents.text: This protected channel:
contents.zh-CHS: 此受保护通道：

contents.text: o Provides replay protection.
contents.zh-CHS: o 提供重播保护。

contents.text: o Encrypts and authenticates a Plain Text Payload that becomes an Encrypted Payload. The Plain Text Payload must not exceed 960 bytes; see Sections 5.3, 5.4, and 8.11.
contents.zh-CHS: o 加密并验证成为加密负载的纯文本负载。纯文本有效负载不得超过960字节；见第5.3、5.4和8.11节。

contents.text: o Only authenticates a Header that is thus sent in clear.
contents.zh-CHS: o 仅对以明文形式发送的标头进行身份验证。

contents.text: EAX is instantiated with AES-128 as the underlying block cipher.
contents.zh-CHS: EAX以AES-128作为基础分组密码进行实例化。

contents.text: AES-128 is keyed with the TEK.
contents.zh-CHS: AES-128采用TEK键控。

contents.text: The nonce N is used to provide cryptographic security to the encryption and data origin authentication as well as protection replay. Indeed, N is a 4-byte sequence number starting from <0> that is monotonically incremented at each EAP-PSK message within one EAP-PSK dialog, except retransmissions, of course.
contents.zh-CHS: nonce N用于为加密和数据源身份验证以及保护重播提供加密安全性。实际上，N是一个4字节的序列号，从<0>开始，在一个EAP-PSK对话框中的每个EAP-PSK消息处单调递增，当然，除了重新传输之外。

contents.text: N was taken to be 4 bytes to avoid 16-byte arithmetic. Since EAX uses a 16-byte nonce, N is padded with 96 zero bits for its high-order bits.
contents.zh-CHS: N被取为4字节，以避免16字节的运算。由于EAX使用16字节的nonce，N的高阶位用96个零位填充。

contents.text: For cryptographic reasons, N is not allowed to wrap around. In the unlikely, yet possible, event of the server sending an EAP-PSK message with N set to <2**32-2>, it must not send any further message on this protected channel, which would cause to reusing the value 0. Either the conversation is finished after the server receives the EAP-PSK answer from the peer with N set to <2**32-1> and the server proceeds (typically by sending an EAP-Success or Failure), or the conversation is not finished and must then be aborted (a new EAP-PSK dialog may subsequently be started to try again to authenticate). Thus, the maximum number of messages that can be exchanged over the same protected channel is 2**32 (which should not be a limitation in practice, as this is approximately equal to 4 billion).
contents.zh-CHS: 出于加密原因，不允许N环绕。如果服务器发送的EAP-PSK消息的N设置为<2**32-2>，则该事件不太可能发生，但也有可能发生，服务器不得在此受保护通道上发送任何进一步的消息，这将导致重用值0。在服务器接收到来自对等方的EAP-PSK应答且N设置为<2**32-1>且服务器继续（通常通过发送EAP成功或失败）后，会话完成，或者会话未完成，然后必须中止（随后可能会启动新的EAP-PSK对话以重试身份验证）。因此，可在同一受保护信道上交换的最大消息数为2**32（这在实践中不应是限制，因为这大约等于40亿）。

contents.text: The Header H consists of the first 22 bytes of the EAP Request or Response packet (i.e., the EAP Code, Identifier, Length, and Type fields followed by the EAP-PSK Flags and RAND_S fields). Although it may appear unorthodox that an upper layer (EAP-PSK) protects some information of the lower layer (EAP), this was chosen to comply with EAP recommendation (see Section 7.5. of [3]) and seems to be existing practice at IETF (see, for instance, [35]).
contents.zh-CHS: 报头H由EAP请求或响应数据包的前22个字节组成（即，EAP代码、标识符、长度和类型字段，后跟EAP-PSK标志和RAND_S字段）。虽然上层（EAP-PSK）保护下层（EAP）的某些信息似乎是非正统的，但选择它是为了符合EAP建议（见[3]第7.5节），并且似乎是IETF的现有做法（例如，见[35]）。

contents.text: The Plain Text Payload is the payload that is to be encrypted and integrity protected. The Cipher Text Payload is the result of the encryption of the Plain Text.
contents.zh-CHS: 纯文本有效负载是要加密和完整性保护的有效负载。密码文本有效负载是纯文本加密的结果。

contents.text: The Tag is a MAC that protects both the Header and the Plain Text Payload. The verification of the Tag must only be done after a successful verification of the Nonce for replay protection. If the verification of the Tag succeeds, then the Encrypted Payload is decrypted to recover the Plain Text Payload. If the verification of the Tag fails, then no decryption is performed and this MAC failure should be logged. The tag length is chosen to be 16 bytes for EAX within EAP-PSK. This length is considered appropriate by the cryptographic community.
contents.zh-CHS: 标签是一个MAC，它同时保护报头和纯文本负载。只有在成功验证用于重播保护的Nonce之后，才能验证标记。如果标记验证成功，则加密的有效负载将被解密以恢复纯文本有效负载。如果标签验证失败，则不执行解密，并且应记录此MAC故障。EAP-PSK中EAX的标记长度选择为16字节。加密社区认为该长度是合适的。

contents.text: EAX was mainly chosen because:
contents.zh-CHS: 选择EAX主要是因为：

contents.text: o It strongly relies on OMAC in its design and OMAC1, a variant of OMAC, had already been chosen in EAP-PSK for the authentication part (please remember that OMAC1 and CMAC are analogous).
contents.zh-CHS: o 它在设计上强烈依赖于OMAC，而OMAC的一个变体OMAC1已经在EAP-PSK中被选择用于认证部分（请记住，OMAC1和CMAC是类似的）。

contents.text: o Its design is simple.
contents.zh-CHS: o 它的设计很简单。

contents.text: o It enjoys a security proof.
contents.zh-CHS: o 它具有安全性证明。

contents.text: o It is free of any Intellectual Property Rights claims.
contents.zh-CHS: o 它没有任何知识产权要求。

contents.text: 4. EAP-PSK Message Flows
contents.zh-CHS: 4. EAP-PSK消息流

contents.text: EAP-PSK may consist of two different types of message flows:
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK可由两种不同类型的消息流组成：

contents.text: o The "standard authentication", which is:
contents.zh-CHS: o “标准认证”，即：

contents.text: * Mandatory to implement.
contents.zh-CHS: * 强制执行。

contents.text: * Fully specified in this document.
contents.zh-CHS: * 在本文件中完全指定。

contents.text: * The simpler type of message flow, which is expected to be used most frequently.
contents.zh-CHS: * 更简单的消息流类型，预计使用频率最高。

contents.text: o The "extended authentication", which is:
contents.zh-CHS: o “扩展身份验证”，即：

contents.text: * Optional to implement (i.e., there are no mandatory extensions).
contents.zh-CHS: * 可选实现（即，没有强制扩展）。

contents.text: * Partly specified in this document since it depends on extensions and none are currently specified, let alone in this document.
contents.zh-CHS: * 部分在本文档中指定，因为它依赖于扩展，并且当前未指定任何扩展，更不用说在本文档中了。

contents.text: * The type of message flow that should be used when extensions of EAP-PSK are needed by more sophisticated usage scenarios and are available.
contents.zh-CHS: * 当更复杂的使用场景需要EAP-PSK扩展时，应该使用的消息流类型，并且可以使用。

contents.text: EAP-PSK introduces the concept of a session to facilitate its analysis and provide a cleaner interface to other layers. A session is a particular instance of an EAP-PSK dialog between two parties. This session is identified by a session identifier.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK引入了会话的概念，以便于分析，并为其他层提供更清晰的接口。会话是双方之间EAP-PSK对话的特定实例。此会话由会话标识符标识。

contents.text: In the first EAP-PSK message, the EAP server asserts its identity. Given that the EAP-Request/Identity and EAP-Response/Identity may not be assumed to have occurred prior to this sending and that the response included in EAP-Response/Identity (if this EAP Identity exchange takes place) may not contain the actual NAI the peer shall
contents.zh-CHS: 在第一条EAP-PSK消息中，EAP服务器断言其标识。鉴于EAP请求/标识和EAP响应/标识可能不会在发送之前发生，且EAP响应/标识中包含的响应（如果发生EAP标识交换）可能不包含实际NAI，对等方应

contents.text: use with EAP-PSK, this means that an EAP server implementing EAP-PSK must use the same EAP server NAI for all EAP-PSK dialogs with any EAP peer implementing EAP-PSK.
contents.zh-CHS: 与EAP-PSK一起使用，这意味着实现EAP-PSK的EAP服务器必须为所有EAP-PSK对话框与任何实现EAP-PSK的EAP对等方使用相同的EAP服务器NAI。

contents.text: 4.1. EAP-PSK Standard Authentication
contents.zh-CHS: 4.1. EAP-PSK标准认证

contents.text: EAP-PSK standard authentication is comprised of four messages, i.e., two round-trips; see Figure 9.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK标准认证由四条消息组成，即两条往返消息；参见图9。

contents.text: Figure 9: EAP-PSK Standard Authentication
contents.zh-CHS: 图9:EAP-PSK标准认证

contents.text: o The first message is sent by the server to the peer to:
contents.zh-CHS: o 第一条消息由服务器发送到对等方：

contents.text: * Send a 16-byte random challenge (RAND_S). RAND_S was called RA in Section 3.2
contents.zh-CHS: * 发送一个16字节的随机质询（随机）。RAND_S在第3.2节中称为RA

contents.text: * State its identity (ID_S). ID_S was denoted by A in Section 3.2.
contents.zh-CHS: * 说明其身份（ID）。ID_S在第3.2节中用A表示。

contents.text: o The second message is sent by the peer to the server to:
contents.zh-CHS: o 第二条消息由对等方发送到服务器：

contents.text: * Send another 16-byte random challenge (RAND_P). RAND_P was called RB in Section 3.2
contents.zh-CHS: * 发送另一个16字节随机质询（RAND_P）。RAND_P在第3.2节中称为RB

contents.text: * State its identity (ID_P). ID_P was denoted by B in Section 3.2.
contents.zh-CHS: * 说明其身份（ID\P）。ID_P在第3.2节中用B表示。

contents.text: * Authenticate to the server by proving that it is able to compute a particular MAC (MAC_P), which is a function of the two challenges and AK: MAC_P = CMAC-AES-128(AK, ID_P||ID_S||RAND_S||RAND_P)
contents.zh-CHS: * 通过证明服务器能够计算特定的MAC（MAC|P），这是两个挑战和AK的函数：MAC|P=CMAC-AES-128（AK，ID|P | ID|S | RAND|S | RAND|P），对服务器进行身份验证

contents.text: o The third message is sent by the server to the peer to:
contents.zh-CHS: o 第三条消息由服务器发送到对等方：

contents.text: * Authenticate to the peer by proving that it is able to compute another MAC (MAC_S), which is a function of the peer's challenge and AK: MAC_S = CMAC-AES-128(AK, ID_S||RAND_P)
contents.zh-CHS: * 通过证明对等方能够计算另一个MAC（MAC|S）进行身份验证，该MAC是对等方挑战的函数，AK:MAC|S=CMAC-AES-128（AK，ID|S | RAND|P）

contents.text: * Set up the protected channel (P_CHANNEL_S_0) to:
contents.zh-CHS: * 将受保护通道（P_通道\u S_0）设置为：

contents.text: + Confirm that it has derived session keys (at least the TEK).
contents.zh-CHS: + 确认它已派生会话密钥（至少是TEK）。

contents.text: + Give a protected result indication of the authentication.
contents.zh-CHS: + 提供身份验证的受保护结果指示。

contents.text: o The fourth message is sent by the peer to the server to finish the setup of the protected channel (P_CHANNEL_P_1) to:
contents.zh-CHS: o 第四条消息由对等方发送到服务器，以完成受保护通道（P_channel_P_1）的设置，发送到：

contents.text: * Confirm that it has derived session keys (at least the TEK).
contents.zh-CHS: * 确认它已派生会话密钥（至少是TEK）。

contents.text: * Give a protected result indication of the authentication.
contents.zh-CHS: * 提供身份验证的受保护结果指示。

contents.text: The PCHANNEL_S_0 and PCHANNEL_P_1 fields of the third and fourth EAP-PSK messages contain a MAC-computed thanks to TEK that protects the integrity of the messages. For a detailed list of the fields of the messages that are integrity protected, please refer to Section 3.3.
contents.zh-CHS: 第三和第四EAP-PSK消息的PCchannel_S_0和PCchannel_P_1字段包含由TEK计算的MAC，TEK保护消息的完整性。有关完整性保护的消息字段的详细列表，请参阅第3.3节。

contents.text: All EAP-PSK messages include a sort of header, which is comprised of two fields:
contents.zh-CHS: 所有EAP-PSK消息都包含一种标头，该标头由两个字段组成：

contents.text: o Flags, a 1-byte field that is currently only used to number EAP-PSK messages.
contents.zh-CHS: o 标志，一个1字节字段，当前仅用于对EAP-PSK消息进行编号。

contents.text: o RAND_S, a 16-byte challenge sent by the server that is used as a session identifier.
contents.zh-CHS: o RAND_S，服务器发送的16字节质询，用作会话标识符。

contents.text: This standard message flow could be comprised of only three messages, like AKEP2, were it not the request/response nature of EAP that prevents the third message to be the last one. Since the fourth message is mandatory, EAP-PSK chose to take advantage of this and set up a protected channel.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果不是EAP的请求/响应特性阻止第三条消息成为最后一条消息，那么这个标准消息流只能由三条消息组成，如AKEP2。由于第四条消息是强制性的，EAP-PSK选择利用这一点并设置受保护的通道。

contents.text: The standard message flow also includes a statement by the peer of its identity, in addition to the EAP-Response/Identity it may have sent. This behavior follows Section 5.1 of [3], which recommends that the EAP-Response/Identity be used primarily for routing purposes and selecting which EAP method to use, and therefore that EAP methods include a method-specific mechanism for obtaining the identity, so that they do not have to rely on the Identity Response.
contents.zh-CHS: 除了可能发送的EAP响应/标识外，标准消息流还包括对等方对其标识的声明。该行为遵循[3]第5.1节，该节建议EAP响应/标识主要用于路由目的和选择要使用的EAP方法，因此EAP方法包括用于获取标识的方法特定机制，以便它们不必依赖标识响应。

contents.text: When a party receives an EAP-PSK message, it checks that the message is syntactically valid in accordance with the message formats defined in Section 5. If the message is syntactically incorrect, then it is silently discarded. Then it checks the cryptographic validity of this message, i.e., it checks the MAC(s) as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 当一方收到EAP-PSK消息时，它根据第5节中定义的消息格式检查该消息在语法上是否有效。如果消息在语法上不正确，那么它将被悄悄地丢弃。然后检查该消息的加密有效性，即检查MAC，如下所示：

contents.text: o If the received message is the first EAP-PSK message, there is no MAC to check as none is included in message 1.
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果收到的消息是第一条EAP-PSK消息，则没有要检查的MAC，因为消息1中不包括MAC。

contents.text: o If the received message is the second EAP-PSK message, the validity of MAC_P is checked.
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果收到的消息是第二条EAP-PSK消息，则检查MAC_P的有效性。

contents.text: o If the received message is the third EAP-PSK message, the validity of MAC_S is checked and then the validity of the Tag included in P_CHANNEL_S_0 is checked. The validity checks must be done in this order to avoid unnecessarily deriving TEK, MSK, and EMSK in case MAC_S is invalid, meaning that mutual authentication has failed. Indeed, TEK is used to verify the validity of the Tag included in P_CHANNEL_S_0.
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果收到的消息是第三条EAP-PSK消息，则检查MAC_S的有效性，然后检查P_信道_S_0中包含的标签的有效性。有效性检查必须按此顺序进行，以避免在MAC_无效的情况下不必要地派生TEK、MSK和EMSK，这意味着相互身份验证失败。事实上，TEK用于验证P_CHANNEL_S_0中包含的标签的有效性。

contents.text: o If the received message is the fourth EAP-PSK message, the validity of the Tag included in P_CHANNEL_P_1 is checked.
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果收到的消息是第四条EAP-PSK消息，则检查P_信道P_1中包含的标签的有效性。

contents.text: If a validity check fails, the message is silently discarded. There can be a counter to track the number of silently discarded messages Section 8.8. If there is an encrypted payload in the message (namely, in the PCHANNEL attribute), then the encrypted payload is decrypted. Then, if the decrypted payload is syntactically incorrect, the message is silently discarded.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果有效性检查失败，消息将被自动丢弃。第8.8节中可以有一个计数器来跟踪静默丢弃的消息数。如果消息中存在加密的有效负载（即，在PCHANNEL属性中），则加密的有效负载将被解密。然后，如果解密的有效负载在语法上不正确，则消息将被悄悄地丢弃。

contents.text: 4.2. EAP-PSK Extended Authentication
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2. EAP-PSK扩展认证

contents.text: To remain simple and yet be extensible to meet future requirements, EAP-PSK provides an extension mechanism within its protected channel: the payload of the protected channel may contain an optional extension field (EXT).
contents.zh-CHS: 为了保持简单且可扩展以满足未来需求，EAP-PSK在其受保护信道内提供了一种扩展机制：受保护信道的有效负载可能包含一个可选扩展字段（EXT）。

contents.text: Figure 10 presents the message sequence for EAP-PSK extended authentication.
contents.zh-CHS: 图10显示了EAP-PSK扩展身份验证的消息序列。

contents.text: Extended authentication MUST be supported, i.e., any EAP-PSK implementation MUST support sending and reception of an EXT attribute according to rules of operation described in Section 6. Yet, although support of the EXT field is mandatory, there is no mandatory extension type to support. This means that if a server engages in EAP-PSK extended authentication, as only the server can start extended authentication per Section 6, a peer will recognize the attempt to start extended authentication through its EXT support. If
contents.zh-CHS: 必须支持扩展认证，即任何EAP-PSK实现必须根据第6节中描述的操作规则支持发送和接收EXT属性。然而，尽管对EXT字段的支持是强制性的，但并没有强制性的扩展类型可支持。这意味着，如果服务器参与EAP-PSK扩展身份验证，因为只有服务器可以根据第6节启动扩展身份验证，对等方将通过其EXT支持识别启动扩展身份验证的尝试。如果

contents.text: the peer does not support the particular extension type used by the server, the peer will still be able to conclude the EAP-PSK dialog.
contents.zh-CHS: 对等方不支持服务器使用的特定扩展类型，对等方仍然能够结束EAP-PSK对话框。

contents.text: The mandatory support of the EXT field is dictated:
contents.zh-CHS: EXT字段的强制支持规定如下：

contents.text: o To guarantee a robust behavior in the future where some peers might support some extensions and others not. All peers will thus be able to understand that an extended authentication is being attempted and indicate whether or not they support the extension that is tried.
contents.zh-CHS: o 为了保证将来在某些对等方可能支持某些扩展而其他对等方不支持的情况下有健壮的行为。因此，所有对等方将能够理解正在尝试扩展身份验证，并指示它们是否支持尝试的扩展。

contents.text: o To ensure that all implementations will indeed be extensible.
contents.zh-CHS: o 确保所有的实现都是可扩展的。

contents.text: No extension is currently defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 当前未定义扩展。

contents.text: At most, one extension may be run within a single EAP-PSK dialog: there can neither be sequences of extensions nor interleaved extensions. However, extensions may take a variable number of round-trips to complete.
contents.zh-CHS: 最多可以在单个EAP-PSK对话框中运行一个扩展：既不能有扩展序列，也不能有交叉扩展。但是，扩展可能需要不同数量的往返才能完成。

contents.text: Only the server can start an extension and, if it does so, it must start it in the first payload it sends over the protected channel.
contents.zh-CHS: 只有服务器可以启动扩展，如果它这样做，它必须在通过受保护通道发送的第一个有效负载中启动它。

contents.text: Figure 10: EAP-PSK Extended Authentication
contents.zh-CHS: 图10:EAP-PSK扩展认证

contents.text: Please refer to Section 6 for more details on how extended authentication works.
contents.zh-CHS: 有关扩展身份验证工作原理的更多详细信息，请参阅第6节。

contents.text: The PCHANNEL_S_2j and PCHANNEL_P_2j+1 fields of the EAP-PSK messages (where j varies from 0 to i) contain a MAC-computed thanks to TEK that protects the integrity of the messages. For a detailed list of the fields of the messages that are integrity protected, please refer to Section 3.3.
contents.zh-CHS: EAP-PSK消息的PCHANNEL_S_2j和PCHANNEL_P_2j+1字段（其中j从0到i变化）包含一个由TEK计算的MAC，TEK保护消息的完整性。有关完整性保护的消息字段的详细列表，请参阅第3.3节。

contents.text: When a party receives an EAP-PSK message, it checks that the message is syntactically valid in accordance with the message formats defined in Section 5. If the message is syntactically incorrect, then it is silently discarded. Then it checks the cryptographic validity of this message, i.e., it checks the MAC(s) as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 当一方收到EAP-PSK消息时，它根据第5节中定义的消息格式检查该消息在语法上是否有效。如果消息在语法上不正确，那么它将被悄悄地丢弃。然后检查该消息的加密有效性，即检查MAC，如下所示：

contents.text: o If the received message is the first EAP-PSK message, there is no MAC to check as none is included in message 1.
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果收到的消息是第一条EAP-PSK消息，则没有要检查的MAC，因为消息1中不包括MAC。

contents.text: o If the received message is the second EAP-PSK message, the validity of MAC_P is checked.
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果收到的消息是第二条EAP-PSK消息，则检查MAC_P的有效性。

contents.text: o If the received message is the third EAP-PSK message, the validity of MAC_S is checked and then the validity of the Tag included in P_CHANNEL_S_0 is checked. The validity checks must be done in this order to avoid unnecessarily deriving TEK, MSK, and EMSK in case MAC_S is invalid, meaning that mutual authentication has failed. Indeed, TEK is used to verify the validity of the Tag included in P_CHANNEL_S_0.
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果收到的消息是第三条EAP-PSK消息，则检查MAC_S的有效性，然后检查P_信道_S_0中包含的标签的有效性。有效性检查必须按此顺序进行，以避免在MAC_无效的情况下不必要地派生TEK、MSK和EMSK，这意味着相互身份验证失败。事实上，TEK用于验证P_CHANNEL_S_0中包含的标签的有效性。

contents.text: o If the received message is the fourth EAP-PSK message, the validity of the Tag included in P_CHANNEL_P_1 is checked.
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果收到的消息是第四条EAP-PSK消息，则检查P_信道P_1中包含的标签的有效性。

contents.text: o If the received message is an EAP-PSK message different from the first four ones, then validity of the Tag included in P_CHANNEL is checked.
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果收到的消息是不同于前四条的EAP-PSK消息，则检查P_信道中包含的标签的有效性。

contents.text: If a validity check fails, the message is silently discarded. There can be a counter to track the number of silently discarded messages Section 8.8. If there is an encrypted payload in the message (namely in the PCHANNEL attribute), then the encrypted payload is decrypted. Then, if the decrypted payload is syntactically incorrect, the message is silently discarded.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果有效性检查失败，消息将被自动丢弃。第8.8节中可以有一个计数器来跟踪静默丢弃的消息数。如果消息中（即PCChannel属性中）存在加密的有效负载，则加密的有效负载将被解密。然后，如果解密的有效负载在语法上不正确，则消息将被悄悄地丢弃。

contents.text: 5. EAP-PSK Message Format
contents.zh-CHS: 5. EAP-PSK消息格式

contents.text: For the sake of simplicity, EAP-PSK uses a fixed message format. There are four different types of EAP-PSK messages:
contents.zh-CHS: 为了简单起见，EAP-PSK使用固定的消息格式。有四种不同类型的EAP-PSK消息：

contents.text: o The first EAP-PSK message, which is sent by the server to the peer.
contents.zh-CHS: o 第一条EAP-PSK消息，由服务器发送给对等方。

contents.text: o The second EAP-PSK message, which is sent by the peer to the server.
contents.zh-CHS: o 第二条EAP-PSK消息，由对等方发送到服务器。

contents.text: o The third EAP-PSK message, which is sent by the server to the peer.
contents.zh-CHS: o 第三条EAP-PSK消息，由服务器发送给对等方。

contents.text: o The fourth EAP-PSK message, which is sent by the peer to the server. This is also the type of message that the peer further sends to the server in case of an extended authentication. This is also essentially the type of message that the server further sends to the peer in case of an extended authentication: the only slight modification that occurs in this last case is the setting of the EAP Code to 1 instead of 2 in the other cases.
contents.zh-CHS: o 第四条EAP-PSK消息，由对等方发送到服务器。这也是对等方在进行扩展身份验证时进一步发送到服务器的消息类型。这本质上也是服务器在扩展身份验证情况下进一步发送给对等方的消息类型：最后一种情况下发生的唯一轻微修改是将EAP代码设置为1，而不是其他情况下的2。

contents.text: For the sake of clarity, the whole EAP packet that encapsulates the EAP-PSK message (i.e., the EAP-PSK message plus its EAP headers) is depicted in Figures 11, 13, 14, and 18.
contents.zh-CHS: 为了清楚起见，图11、13、14和18中描述了封装EAP-PSK消息的整个EAP分组（即，EAP-PSK消息及其EAP报头）。

contents.text: 5.1. EAP-PSK First Message
contents.zh-CHS: 5.1. EAP-PSK第一条消息

contents.text: The first EAP-PSK message is sent by the server to the peer. It has the format presented in Figure 11.
contents.zh-CHS: 第一条EAP-PSK消息由服务器发送给对等方。它的格式如图11所示。

contents.text: Figure 11: EAP-PSK First Message
contents.zh-CHS: 图11:EAP-PSK第一条消息

contents.text: Since IANA has allocated EAP method type 47 for EAP-PSK, Type EAP-PSK for the first EAP-PSK message as well as any other EAP-PSK message MUST be 47.
contents.zh-CHS: 由于IANA已为EAP-PSK分配了EAP方法类型47，因此第一条EAP-PSK消息以及任何其他EAP-PSK消息的类型EAP-PSK必须为47。

contents.text: The first EAP-PSK message consists of:
contents.zh-CHS: 第一条EAP-PSK消息包括：

contents.text: o A 1-byte Flags field
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个1字节的标志字段

contents.text: o A 16-byte random number: RAND_S
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个16字节的随机数：RAND_S

contents.text: o A variable length field that conveys the server's NAI: ID_S. The length of this field is deduced from the EAP length field. The length of this NAI must not exceed 966 bytes. This restriction aims at avoiding fragmentation issues (see Section 8.11).
contents.zh-CHS: o 表示服务器的NAI:ID_s的可变长度字段。此字段的长度由EAP长度字段推导而来。此NAI的长度不得超过966字节。该限制旨在避免碎片问题（见第8.11节）。

contents.text: The Flags field has the format presented in Figure 12.
contents.zh-CHS: Flags字段的格式如图12所示。

contents.text: Figure 12: EAP-PSK Flags Field
contents.zh-CHS: 图12:EAP-PSK标志字段

contents.text: The Flags field is comprised of two subfields:
contents.zh-CHS: Flags字段由两个子字段组成：

contents.text: o A 2-bit T subfield, which indicates the type of EAP-PSK message:
contents.zh-CHS: o 2位T子字段，指示EAP-PSK消息的类型：

contents.text: * T=0 for the first EAP-PSK message presented in Section 5.1.
contents.zh-CHS: * 第5.1节中给出的第一条EAP-PSK消息的T=0。

contents.text: * T=1 for the second EAP-PSK message presented in Section 5.2.
contents.zh-CHS: * 第5.2节中给出的第二条EAP-PSK消息的T=1。

contents.text: * T=2 for the third EAP-PSK message presented in Section 5.3.
contents.zh-CHS: * 第5.3节中给出的第三条EAP-PSK消息的T=2。

contents.text: * T=3 for the fourth EAP-PSK message presented in Section 5.4 and the subsequent EAP-PSK messages that may be exchanged during extended authentication.
contents.zh-CHS: * 对于第5.4节中显示的第四条EAP-PSK消息以及扩展身份验证期间可能交换的后续EAP-PSK消息，T=3。

contents.text: o A 6-bit Reserved subfield that is set to zero on transmission and ignored on reception.
contents.zh-CHS: o 一种6位保留子字段，在传输时设置为零，在接收时忽略。

contents.text: The PCHANNEL Nonce field N (see Section 5.3) is used to distinguish between the different EAP-PSK messages that may be exchanged during extended authentication that all have T set to 3, i.e., the fourth EAP-PSK message and possibly the next ones.
contents.zh-CHS: PCHANNEL Nonce字段N（参见第5.3节）用于区分在扩展认证期间可能交换的不同EAP-PSK消息，这些消息都未设置为3，即第四条EAP-PSK消息和可能的下一条EAP-PSK消息。

contents.text: 5.2. EAP-PSK Second Message
contents.zh-CHS: 5.2. EAP-PSK第二条消息

contents.text: The second EAP-PSK message is sent by the peer to the server. It has the format presented in Figure 13.
contents.zh-CHS: 第二条EAP-PSK消息由对等方发送到服务器。它的格式如图13所示。

contents.text: Figure 13: EAP-PSK Second Message
contents.zh-CHS: 图13:EAP-PSK第二条消息

contents.text: It consists of:
contents.zh-CHS: 它包括：

contents.text: o A 1-byte Flags field
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个1字节的标志字段

contents.text: o The 16-byte random number sent by the server in the first EAP-PSK message (RAND_S) that serves as a session identifier
contents.zh-CHS: o 服务器在作为会话标识符的第一条EAP-PSK消息（RAND_S）中发送的16字节随机数

contents.text: o A 16-byte random number: RAND_P
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个16字节的随机数：RAND\u P

contents.text: o A 16-byte MAC: MAC_P
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个16字节的MAC:MAC\P

contents.text: o A variable length field that conveys the peer's NAI: ID_P. The length of this field is deduced from the EAP length field. The length of this NAI must not exceed 966 bytes. This restriction aims at avoiding fragmentation issues (see Section 8.11).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个可变长度字段，用于传递对等方的NAI:ID_P。该字段的长度由EAP长度字段推导而来。此NAI的长度不得超过966字节。该限制旨在避免碎片问题（见第8.11节）。

contents.text: The Flags field format is presented in Figure 12.
contents.zh-CHS: Flags字段格式如图12所示。

contents.text: 5.3. EAP-PSK Third Message
contents.zh-CHS: 5.3. EAP-PSK第三条消息

contents.text: The third EAP-PSK message is sent by the server to the peer. It has the format presented in Figure 14.
contents.zh-CHS: 第三条EAP-PSK消息由服务器发送给对等方。它的格式如图14所示。

contents.text: Figure 14: EAP-PSK Third Message
contents.zh-CHS: 图14:PSK第三条消息

contents.text: It consists of:
contents.zh-CHS: 它包括：

contents.text: o A 1-byte Flags field
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个1字节的标志字段

contents.text: o The 16-byte random number sent by the server in the first EAP-PSK message (RAND_S) that is used as a session identifier
contents.zh-CHS: o 服务器在用作会话标识符的第一条EAP-PSK消息（RAND_S）中发送的16字节随机数

contents.text: o A 16-byte MAC: MAC_S
contents.zh-CHS: o 16字节MAC:MAC\S

contents.text: o A variable length field that constitutes the protected channel: PCHANNEL
contents.zh-CHS: o 构成受保护通道的可变长度字段：PCHANNEL

contents.text: The Flags field format is presented in Figure 12.
contents.zh-CHS: Flags字段格式如图12所示。

contents.text: If there is no extension, i.e., if the authentication is standard, the PCHANNEL field consists of:
contents.zh-CHS: 如果没有扩展，即如果认证是标准的，则PCChannel字段包括：

contents.text: o A 4-byte Nonce N (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个4字节的Nonce N（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: o A 16-byte Tag (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个16字节的标签（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: o A 2-bit result indication flag R.
contents.zh-CHS: o 2位结果指示标志R。

contents.text: o A 1-bit extension flag E, which is set to 0.
contents.zh-CHS: o 1位扩展标志E，设置为0。

contents.text: o A 5-bit Reserved field, which is set to zero on emission and ignored on reception.
contents.zh-CHS: o 5位保留字段，发射时设置为零，接收时忽略。

contents.text: R, E, and Reserved are sent encrypted by the protected channel (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: R、 E和保留的数据由受保护通道加密发送（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: If there is no extension, PCHANNEL has the format presented in Figure 15 (where R, E, and Reserved are presented in the clear for the sake of clarity, although in reality they are sent encrypted).
contents.zh-CHS: 如果没有扩展，PCChannel的格式如图15所示（其中R、E和Reserved为清晰起见以明文形式显示，尽管实际上它们是加密发送的）。

contents.text: Figure 15: The PCHANNEL Field with E=0
contents.zh-CHS: 图15：E=0的PCChannel字段

contents.text: If there is an extension, i.e., if the authentication is extended, the PCHANNEL field consists of:
contents.zh-CHS: 如果存在扩展，即如果认证被扩展，则PCHANNEL字段包括：

contents.text: o A 4-byte Nonce N (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个4字节的Nonce N（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: o A 16-byte Tag (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个16字节的标签（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: o A 2-bit result indication flag R.
contents.zh-CHS: o 2位结果指示标志R。

contents.text: o A 1-bit extension flag E, which is set to 1.
contents.zh-CHS: o 1位扩展标志E，设置为1。

contents.text: o A 5-bit Reserved field, which is set to zero on emission and ignored on reception.
contents.zh-CHS: o 5位保留字段，发射时设置为零，接收时忽略。

contents.text: o A variable length EXT field.
contents.zh-CHS: o 可变长度的外部字段。

contents.text: R, E, Reserved, and EXT are sent encrypted by the protected channel (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: R、 E、Reserved和EXT由受保护通道加密发送（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: If there is an extension, PCHANNEL has the format presented in Figure 16 where R, E, Reserved and EXT are presented in the clear for the sake of clarity, although in reality they are sent encrypted).
contents.zh-CHS: 如果有扩展，PCChannel的格式如图16所示，为了清晰起见，R、E、Reserved和EXT以明文形式显示，但实际上它们是加密发送的）。

contents.text: Figure 16: The PCHANNEL Field with E=1
contents.zh-CHS: 图16：E=1的PCChannel字段

contents.text: This EXT field is split in two subfields:
contents.zh-CHS: 此EXT字段分为两个子字段：

contents.text: o The EXT_Type subfield, which indicates the type of the extension
contents.zh-CHS: o EXT_Type子字段，指示扩展的类型

contents.text: o The EXT_Payload subfield, which consists of the payload of the extension. The EXT_Payload length is derived from the EAP Length field. EXT_Payload must have a bit length that is a multiple of 8 bits and must not exceed 960 bytes. The latter restriction aims
contents.zh-CHS: o EXT_有效载荷子字段，由扩展的有效载荷组成。EXT_有效负载长度来自EAP长度字段。EXT_有效负载的位长度必须是8位的倍数，且不得超过960字节。后一项限制旨在

contents.text: at avoiding fragmentation issues (see Section 8.11), whereas the former comes from the EAP length being specified in bytes.
contents.zh-CHS: 在避免碎片问题时（参见第8.11节），前者来自以字节为单位指定的EAP长度。

contents.text: The format of the EXT field is presented in Figure 17.
contents.zh-CHS: EXT字段的格式如图17所示。

contents.text: Figure 17: The EXT Field
contents.zh-CHS: 图17:EXT字段

contents.text: 5.4. EAP-PSK Fourth Message
contents.zh-CHS: 5.4. EAP-PSK第四消息

contents.text: The fourth EAP-PSK message is sent by the peer to the server. It has the format presented in Figure 18.
contents.zh-CHS: 第四条EAP-PSK消息由对等方发送到服务器。它的格式如图18所示。

contents.text: Figure 18: EAP-PSK Fourth Message
contents.zh-CHS: 图18:EAP-PSK第四条消息

contents.text: It consists of:
contents.zh-CHS: 它包括：

contents.text: o A 1-byte Flags field
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个1字节的标志字段

contents.text: o The 16-byte random number sent by the server in the first EAP-PSK message (RAND_S) that is used as a session identifier
contents.zh-CHS: o 服务器在用作会话标识符的第一条EAP-PSK消息（RAND_S）中发送的16字节随机数

contents.text: o A variable length field that constitutes the protected channel: PCHANNEL
contents.zh-CHS: o 构成受保护通道的可变长度字段：PCHANNEL

contents.text: The Flags field format is presented in Figure 12.
contents.zh-CHS: Flags字段格式如图12所示。

contents.text: The PCHANNEL field has the following structure, which was already described in Section 5.3.
contents.zh-CHS: PCChannel字段具有以下结构，已在第5.3节中描述。

contents.text: If there is no extension, i.e., if the authentication is standard, the PCHANNEL field consists of:
contents.zh-CHS: 如果没有扩展，即如果认证是标准的，则PCChannel字段包括：

contents.text: o A 4-byte Nonce N (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个4字节的Nonce N（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: o A 16-byte Tag (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个16字节的标签（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: o A 2-bit result indication flag R.
contents.zh-CHS: o 2位结果指示标志R。

contents.text: o A 1-bit extension flag E, which is set to 0.
contents.zh-CHS: o 1位扩展标志E，设置为0。

contents.text: o A 5-bit Reserved field, which is set to zero on emission and ignored on reception.
contents.zh-CHS: o 5位保留字段，发射时设置为零，接收时忽略。

contents.text: R, E, and Reserved are sent encrypted by the protected channel (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: R、 E和保留的数据由受保护通道加密发送（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: If there is no extension, PCHANNEL has the format presented in Figure 15.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果没有扩展，PCChannel的格式如图15所示。

contents.text: If there is an extension, i.e., if the authentication is extended, the PCHANNEL field consists of:
contents.zh-CHS: 如果存在扩展，即如果认证被扩展，则PCHANNEL字段包括：

contents.text: o A 4-byte Nonce N (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个4字节的Nonce N（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: o A 16-byte Tag (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: o 一个16字节的标签（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: o A 2-bit result indication flag R.
contents.zh-CHS: o 2位结果指示标志R。

contents.text: o A 1-bit extension flag E, which is set to 1.
contents.zh-CHS: o 1位扩展标志E，设置为1。

contents.text: o A 5-bit Reserved field, which is set to zero on emission and ignored on reception.
contents.zh-CHS: o 5位保留字段，发射时设置为零，接收时忽略。

contents.text: o A variable length EXT field.
contents.zh-CHS: o 可变长度的外部字段。

contents.text: R, E, Reserved, and EXT are sent encrypted by the protected channel (see Section 3.3).
contents.zh-CHS: R、 E、Reserved和EXT由受保护通道加密发送（见第3.3节）。

contents.text: If there is an extension, PCHANNEL has the format presented in Figure 16.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果有扩展名，PCChannel的格式如图16所示。

contents.text: This EXT field is split in two subfields:
contents.zh-CHS: 此EXT字段分为两个子字段：

contents.text: o The EXT_Type subfield, which indicates the type of the extension
contents.zh-CHS: o EXT_Type子字段，指示扩展的类型

contents.text: o The EXT_Payload subfield, which consists of the payload of the extension. The EXT_Payload length is derived from the EAP Length field. EXT_Payload must have a bit length that is a multiple of 8 bits and must not exceed 960 bytes. The latter restriction aims at avoiding fragmentation issues (see Section 8.11).
contents.zh-CHS: o EXT_有效载荷子字段，由扩展的有效载荷组成。EXT_有效负载长度来自EAP长度字段。EXT_有效负载的位长度必须是8位的倍数，且不得超过960字节。后一种限制旨在避免碎片问题（见第8.11节）。

contents.text: The format of the EXT field is presented in Figure 17.
contents.zh-CHS: EXT字段的格式如图17所示。

contents.text: 6. Rules of Operation for the EAP-PSK Protected Channel
contents.zh-CHS: 6. EAP-PSK保护信道的操作规则

contents.text: In this section, the rules of operation of the EAP-PSK protected channel are presented:
contents.zh-CHS: 本节介绍了EAP-PSK保护信道的操作规则：

contents.text: o How protected result indications are implemented.
contents.zh-CHS: o 如何实施受保护的结果指示。

contents.text: o How an extended authentication works in details.
contents.zh-CHS: o 详细介绍了扩展身份验证的工作原理。

contents.text: 6.1. Protected Result Indications
contents.zh-CHS: 6.1. 保护结果指示

contents.text: The R flag of the PCHANNEL field in the third and fourth types of EAP-PSK messages is used to provide result indications.
contents.zh-CHS: 第三类和第四类EAP-PSK消息中PCChannel字段的R标志用于提供结果指示。

contents.text: Since this 2-bit flag is communicated over the protected channel, it is:
contents.zh-CHS: 由于该2位标志通过受保护信道进行通信，因此：

contents.text: o Encrypted so that only the peer and the server can know its value.
contents.zh-CHS: o 加密，以便只有对等方和服务器可以知道其值。

contents.text: o Integrity-protected so that it cannot be modified by an attacker without the peer or the server detecting this modification.
contents.zh-CHS: o 完整性受到保护，因此攻击者无法在对等方或服务器未检测到此修改的情况下对其进行修改。

contents.text: o Protected against replays.
contents.zh-CHS: o 防止重播。

contents.text: This 2-bit R flag can take the following values:
contents.zh-CHS: 此2位R标志可以采用以下值：

contents.text: o 01 to mean CONT
contents.zh-CHS: o 01表示继续

contents.text: o 10 to mean DONE_SUCCESS
contents.zh-CHS: o 10表示成功

contents.text: o 11 to mean DONE_FAILURE
contents.zh-CHS: o 11表示完成或失败

contents.text: The peer and the server each remember some information about both the values of R that they have sent and the values of R they have received. It is the conjunction of both sent and received R values that indicate the success or the failure of the EAP-PSK dialog.
contents.zh-CHS: 对等方和服务器都会记住一些关于发送的R值和接收的R值的信息。发送和接收的R值的结合表示EAP-PSK对话框的成功或失败。

contents.text: In the case of a standard authentication, the following values of R should be exchanged:
contents.zh-CHS: 对于标准身份验证，应交换以下R值：

contents.text: o Either the server sends a DONE_SUCCESS in the PCHANNEL of the third EAP-PSK message, to which the peer replies with a DONE_SUCCESS in the PCHANNEL of the fourth EAP-PSK message, which successfully ends the EAP-PSK dialog.
contents.zh-CHS: o 服务器在第三条EAP-PSK消息的PCChannel中发送DONE_SUCCESS，对等方在第四条EAP-PSK消息的PCChannel中回复DONE_SUCCESS，从而成功结束EAP-PSK对话框。

contents.text: o Or the server sends a DONE_FAILURE in the PCHANNEL of the third EAP-PSK message, to which the peer replies with a DONE_FAILURE in the PCHANNEL of the fourth EAP-PSK message, which unsuccessfully ends the EAP-PSK dialog.
contents.zh-CHS: o 或者，服务器在第三条EAP-PSK消息的PCChannel中发送DONE_故障，对等方在第四条EAP-PSK消息的PCChannel中回复DONE_故障，但未成功结束EAP-PSK对话框。

contents.text: In the case of an extended authentication, more complex exchanges may occur, which is why the CONT value was introduced.
contents.zh-CHS: 在扩展身份验证的情况下，可能会发生更复杂的交换，这就是引入CONT值的原因。

contents.text: The rules of operation for each value that R may take are detailed below.
contents.zh-CHS: R可能采用的每个值的操作规则如下所述。

contents.text: 6.1.1. CONT
The server and the peer each initialize the values of R they intend to send and receive as CONT.
contents.zh-CHS: 服务器和对等方各自初始化它们打算作为CONT发送和接收的R的值。

contents.text: Here CONT stands for "Continue". It indicates that the EAP-PSK dialog is not yet successful and that the party sending it wants to continue the dialog to try and reach success.
contents.zh-CHS: 这里CONT代表“Continue”。它表示EAP-PSK对话尚未成功，发送该对话的一方希望继续对话以尝试并取得成功。

contents.text: Indeed, although the peer and the server must have successfully authenticated each other, thanks to MAC_P and MAC_S, before they start communicating over the protected channel, the EAP-PSK dialog may not yet be deemed successful after this mutual authentication because of authorization issues. For instance, a prepaid customer of a wireless Hot-Spot might have successfully authenticated but has to refill its account, e.g., with a credit card transaction over the protected channel, before it is authorized.
contents.zh-CHS: 事实上，尽管对等方和服务器在开始通过受保护信道进行通信之前必须已经成功地相互认证，但由于授权问题，EAP-PSK对话在相互认证之后可能尚未被视为成功。例如，无线热点的预付费客户可能已经成功地进行了身份验证，但必须在获得授权之前重新注册其帐户，例如，通过受保护的渠道进行信用卡交易。

contents.text: 6.1.2. DONE_SUCCESS
contents.zh-CHS: 6.1.2. 成功了吗

contents.text: DONE_SUCCESS indicates that the party that sent it deems the EAP-PSK dialog successful and therefore proposes to end this dialog.
contents.zh-CHS: 因此，EAP-PSK认为该对话已成功结束。

contents.text: Once the server has sent a DONE_SUCCESS, it must keep sending this value for R.
contents.zh-CHS: 一旦服务器发送了一个DONE_SUCCESS，它就必须继续为R发送这个值。

contents.text: The peer must first receive a DONE_SUCCESS from the server before it is allowed to send a DONE_SUCCESS.
contents.zh-CHS: 对等方必须首先从服务器接收“已完成”成功，然后才允许其发送“已完成”成功。

contents.text: After the peer has received a DONE_SUCCESS from the server, it may:
contents.zh-CHS: 对等方从服务器接收到DONE_成功后，可能会：

contents.text: o Send a CONT to the server if it has not reached success on its side. The server that receives a CONT should continue the EAP-PSK dialog (see Section 8.2 for some discussion on the security implications of this).
contents.zh-CHS: o 如果服务器未成功，则向服务器发送CONT。接收CONT的服务器应继续EAP-PSK对话框（有关此对话框的安全含义，请参阅第8.2节）。

contents.text: o Send a DONE_SUCCESS to the server, which will end the EAP-PSK dialog with success.
contents.zh-CHS: o 将DONE_SUCCESS发送到服务器，服务器将以SUCCESS结束EAP-PSK对话框。

contents.text: o Send a DONE_FAILURE to the server, which will end the EAP-PSK dialog with failure.
contents.zh-CHS: o 向服务器发送一个DONE_故障，这将以故障结束EAP-PSK对话框。

contents.text: 6.1.3. DONE_FAILURE
DONE_FAILURE indicates that the party that sent it deems the EAP-PSK dialog unsuccessful and proposes to end this dialog because nothing will make it change its mind.
contents.zh-CHS: DONE_FAILURE表示发送它的一方认为EAP-PSK对话不成功，并建议结束此对话，因为没有任何东西会使它改变主意。

contents.text: If the server is the first to send a DONE_FAILURE, then the peer that receives this DONE_FAILURE must reply with a DONE_FAILURE and fail, which ends the EAP-PSK dialog.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果服务器是第一个发送DONE_故障的，则接收该DONE_故障的对等方必须回复DONE_故障和fail，从而结束EAP-PSK对话框。

contents.text: If the peer is the first to send a DONE_FAILURE, then the server that receives this DONE_FAILURE must immediately end this EAP-PSK dialog without sending any further EAP-PSK message, and fail.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果对等方是第一个发送“已完成”故障的，则接收此“已完成”故障的服务器必须立即结束此EAP-PSK对话框，而不发送任何进一步的EAP-PSK消息，并且失败。

contents.text: 6.2. Extended Authentication
contents.zh-CHS: 6.2. 扩展身份验证

contents.text: An extended authentication can only be started by the server.
contents.zh-CHS: 扩展身份验证只能由服务器启动。

contents.text: Exactly one extension (identified by the EXT_Type subfield of the EXT field) must be run during an EAP-PSK extended authentication dialog.
contents.zh-CHS: 在EAP-PSK扩展身份验证对话框期间，必须只运行一个扩展（由扩展字段的EXT_Type子字段标识）。

contents.text: The extension is run over the protected channel: it can assume confidentiality, integrity, and replay protection.
contents.zh-CHS: 扩展在受保护的通道上运行：它可以承担机密性、完整性和重播保护。

contents.text: To start an extended authentication, the server sets the PCHANNEL E flag to 1 and includes the EXT_Payload of the extension it has chosen.
contents.zh-CHS: 要启动扩展身份验证，服务器将PCHANNEL E标志设置为1，并包括其选择的扩展的EXT_有效负载。

contents.text: Since EAP-PSK does not provide fragmentation, the extension must not send an EXT_Payload larger than 960 bytes, which corresponds to the 1020-byte EAP MTU that may minimally be assumed (see [3]).
contents.zh-CHS: 由于EAP-PSK不提供分段，因此扩展不能发送大于960字节的EXT_有效负载，这对应于可以最低限度假设的1020字节EAP MTU（参见[3]）。

contents.text: Moreover, an extension must not send an empty EXT_Payload (because this has a particular meaning for EAP-PSK; see below).
contents.zh-CHS: 此外，扩展不能发送空的EXT_负载（因为这对EAP-PSK有特殊意义；请参见下文）。

contents.text: When the peer receives the third EAP-PSK message with the E flag set to 1, it checks whether it is able to process the proposed extension.
contents.zh-CHS: 当对等方收到E标志设置为1的第三条EAP-PSK消息时，它检查是否能够处理提议的扩展。

contents.text: If the peer is not able to process the proposed extension, i.e., it does not recognize the EXT_Type of the proposed extension, it sets E=1 in its reply (the fourth EAP-PSK message) and include an EXT field of the same EXT_Type but with an empty EXT_Payload.
